mfm.plots.lineplot module¶

class mfm.plots.lineplot.LinePlot(fit: mfm.fitting.fit.FitGroup, scale_x: str = 'lin', d_scaley: str = 'lin', r_scaley: str = 'lin', reference_curve: bool = False, x_label: str = 'x', y_label: str = 'y', plot_irf: bool = False, data_x: Optional[numpy.array] = None, data_y: Optional[numpy.array] = None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: mfm.plots.plotbase.Plot

Started off as a plotting class to display TCSPC-data displaying the IRF, the experimental data, the residuals and the autocorrelation of the residuals. Now it is also used also for FCS-data.

In case the models is a LifetimeModel it takes the irf and displays it:

irf = fit.models.convolve.irf irf_y = irf.y

The models data and the weighted residuals are taken directly from the fit:

model_x, model_y = fit[:] wres_y = fit.weighted_residuals

name = 'Fit'¶
update_all(self, only_fit_range: 'bool' = False, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

mfm.plots.parameter_scan module¶

class mfm.plots.parameter_scan.ParameterScanPlot(fit, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: mfm.plots.plotbase.Plot

Started off as a plotting class to display TCSPC-data displaying the IRF, the experimental data, the residuals and the autocorrelation of the residuals. Now it is also used also for FCS-data.

In case the model is a LifetimeModel it takes the irf and displays it:

irf = fit.model.convolve.irf irf_y = irf.y

The model data and the weighted residuals are taken directly from the fit:

model_x, model_y = fit[:] wres_y = fit.weighted_residuals

name = 'Parameter scan'¶
update_all(self, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶
